IntervalArithmetics Module

  • Functions from intervals.jl file
IntervalArithmetic.Interval — Type
Interval{T<:Number}

Struct that holds all necessary informatino about the Interval

IntervalArithmetic.Interval — Method
Interval(a::T, b::T)

Create Interval using Interval struct

IntervalArithmetic.Interval — Method
Interval(a::T)

Create Interval with only single value

Expanding Base Module functions

  • Functions from arithmetics.jl file
  • Expanded usage of Base Module
  • Added new input arguments with Interval struct from this Module

Comparison

Base.:== — Method
==(a::Interval, b::Interval)

Checks if the intervals a and b are equal.

Base.:!= — Method
!=(a::Interval, b::Interval)

Checks if the intervals a and b are not equal.

Base.:< — Method
<(a::Interval, b::Interval)

Compare if a < b.

Base.:> — Method
>(a::Interval, b::Interval)

Compare if a > b.

Addition and Substraction

Base.:+ — Method
+(a::Interval)

Interval does not change

Base.:- — Method
-(a::Interval)

Changes the Interval to negative values

Base.:+ — Method
+(a::Interval, b)

Addition (Interval,Number)

Base.:+ — Method
+(b, a::Interval)

Addition (Number, Interval)

Base.:- — Method
-(a::Interval, b)

Substratction (Interval,Number)

Base.:- — Method
-(b, a::Interval)

Substratction (Number,Interval)

Base.:+ — Method
+(a::Interval, b::Interval)

Addition (Interval, Interval)

Base.:- — Method
-(a::Interval, b::Interval)

Substratction (Interval, Interval)

Multiplication and division

Base.:* — Method
*(x, a::Interval)

Multiplication (Number, Interval)

Base.:* — Method
*(a::Interval, x)

Multiplication (Interval, Number)

Base.:* — Method
*(a::Interval, b::Interval)

Multiplication (Interval, Interval)

Base.:/ — Method

Division (Interval, Number)

Base.inv — Method
inv(a::Interval)

Inversion (Interval)

Base.:/ — Method
